arts.ttl: Leicester boss Steve Cooper slams two controversies that benefitted 'lucky' Arsenal
arts.sum: Leicester suffered a gut-wrenching defeat to Arsenal on Saturday, with Foxes boss Steve Cooper left furious with referee Sam Barrott over two of the Gunners' goals

arts.ttl: 'Beyond belief' - Leicester boss Steve Cooper fumes at Arsenal decision after dramatic ending - football.london
arts.sum: Despite the result, Cooper expressed pride in his team's performance, particularly their resilience against Arsenal's first-half dominance. In his post-match comments, Cooper hinted that Leicester should have been awarded a free-kick leading up to Arsenal's opening goal., with the Leicester manager shown a yellow card for his protestations at the time.

arts.ttl: Arsenal 4-2 Leicester: Player ratings as late strikes spare Gunners' blushes
arts.sum: Arsenal produced two stoppage-time strikes to beat Leicester 4-2 on Saturday afternoon, having surrendered a two-goal lead in the second half. The Gunners strolled to a two-goal half-time lead against an apathetic Leicester side with composed efforts from Gabriel Martinelli and Leandro Trossard putting the Gunners in complete control.

arts.ttl: Arsenal 4-2 Leicester City live reaction as added-time double breaks City hearts
arts.sum: “It was a really tough first half and we knew it was possible we’d have to suffer in these games in terms of possession and territory, but there was too much of that in the first half. It’s another game we don’t win, but I see the guys every day, I see how hard they work, I see the spirit and the engagement in the plan.

arts.ttl: Arsenal’s late Leicester heroics reveal crucial factor in Premier League title ‘war’
arts.sum: Arsenal 4-2 Leicester: The Gunners were pushed hard by the Foxes and only an injury-time own goal from Wilfred Ndidi and Kai Havertz’s even later effort saw them snatch three points

arts.ttl: Arsenal ‘suffered more than we should have’ in dramatic Leicester win
arts.sum: Arsenal boss Mikel Arteta admitted his side “suffered” more than they should have before eventually beating Leicester City in a six-goal thriller. Gabriel Martinelli put the Gunners ahead in the 20th minute before Leandro Trossard doubled their lead in first-half stoppage time. A stunning goal from James Justin shortly after the interval got the Foxes […] The post Arsenal ‘suffered more than we should have’ in dramatic Leicester win first appeared on The Football Faithful.

arts.ttl: Mikel Arteta makes admission about Arsenal's win over Leicester - 'It was worrying'
arts.sum: Arsenal looked like they were going to be left frustrated against Leicester but stoppage-time strikes from Leandro Trossard and Kai Havertz secured the Gunners a dramatic victory

arts.ttl: Leicester ratings v Arsenal as Hermansen's inspired display can't stop late loss
arts.sum: A special James Justin volley and an inspired Mads Hermansen performance looked like earning Steve Cooper his best result of the season so far as City came from two goals down to level. Vardy won the free-kick, Buonanotte crossed, and Justin, with just City’s second touch in the Arsenal box, flicked a header goalwards, a deflection off Havertz taking it past David Raya.

arts.ttl: Arsenal 4-2 Leicester: Highlights, man of the match, stats from six-goal thriller
arts.sum: Leandro Trossard scores a last-gasp winning goal as Arsenal incredibly hold off a Leicester City fightback to prevail 3-2 at the Emirates.

arts.ttl: Arsenal strike twice in stoppage time to see off stubborn Leicester
arts.sum: The Foxes had come from two goals down to level.
